Returns: The system identifier as a string, or null if none is available.

LocatorImpl().Description: Zero-argument constructor. This will not normally be useful, since the main purpose of this class is to make a snapshot of an existing Locator.

Parameters: String: The new system identifier, or null if none is available.
setSystemId(java.lang.String).Description: Set the system identifier for this locator.

Returns: The line number as an integer, or -1 if none is available.
The public identifier as a string, or null if none is available.
The column number as an integer, or -1 if none is available.

LocatorImpl(org.xml.sax.Locator).Description: Copy constructor. Create a persistent copy of the current state of a locator. When the original locator changes, this copy will still keep the original values (and it can be used outside the scope of DocumentHandler methods).

Parameters: int: The column number, or -1 if none is available.
setColumnNumber(int).Description: Set the column number for this locator (1-based).

Parameters: String: The new public identifier, or null if none is available.
setPublicId(java.lang.String).Description: Set the public identifier for this locator.

Parameters: int: The line number, or -1 if none is available.
setLineNumber(int).Description: Set the line number for this locator (1-based).

ClassDesc: Provide an optional convenience implementation of Locator. This class is available mainly for application writers, who can use it to make a persistent snapshot of a locator at any point during a document parse: Normally, parser writers will not use this class, since it is more efficient to provide location information only when requested, rather than constantly updating a Locator object.
